Discovered in 1943 by Swiss chemist Albert Hofmann, LSD was hailed as a powerful 

tool to treat alcoholism and drug addiction and to provide a window into 

schizophrenia and other mental illnesses. While researchers were establishing the 

medical benefits of LSD, others, such as Brave New World author Aldous Huxley, 

promoted the drug as a powerful tool for mental exploration and self-

understanding. At Harvard, Timothy Leary, Ralph Metzner and Ram Dass (then known 

as Richard Alpert) became popular heroes after the university canceled their 

research project into psychedelics.
